alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 3:41PM EST until January 15 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr affecting Morris County. For the Rockaway River...including Boonton Below Resvr...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rockaway River at Boonton Below Resvr. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding occurs on Vail Road in Montville. The Road heading into Parsippany is subject to closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM EST Saturday the stage was 5.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 PM EST Saturday was 5.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 5.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 5.5 feet on 03/30/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Stg Time Date Rockaway River Boonton Below R 5.0 5.2 Sat 3 pm 5.2 4.6 5.5 7pm 1/13 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 345 AM EST.
